title: Nanotech Cleanroom Adventure #71
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Decontamination Chamber
rooms.description: A sterile white chamber with UV lights mounted on the ceiling. The air smells of disinfectant and ozone. Warning signs about contamination protocols cover the walls. A sealed airlock door leads deeper into the facility. Equipment lockers line one wall.

items.name: equipment storage locker
items.description: A tall metal locker containing cleanroom supplies and equipment

items.name: cleanroom safety manual
items.description: A laminated manual with safety protocols and procedures
items.text: CLEANROOM PROTOCOL: All personnel must maintain particle count below 100 particles per cubic meter. Access keycard required for airlock entry. Lead researcher: Dr Sarah Chen. Project: Nanobot Assembly. Location: Research Lab Alpha.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A white plastic keycard with a magnetic strip and security chip

items.name: decontamination station
items.description: A station with air jets and chemical sprayers for removing contaminants

items.name: maintenance logbook
items.description: A digital tablet showing recent maintenance records
items.text: Maintenance Log Entry: Airlock system serviced. Vault combination changed to match nanobot scale specifications: 1 nanometer, 50 nanometers, 25 nanometers. Remember the order for vault access.

items.name: pressurized airlock door
items.description: A heavy airlock door with a card reader and pressure gauge. Red lights indicate it is sealed.

rooms.name: Main Cleanroom Laboratory
rooms.description: A vast laboratory with white walls and floors. HEPA filters hum overhead, maintaining positive air pressure. Workbenches hold microscopes and precision instruments. Robotic arms are frozen mid-assembly. A massive vault door dominates the far wall. Display screens show magnified views of nanoscale structures.

items.name: primary research workbench
items.description: A workbench covered with scientific instruments and research materials

items.name: research notes from Dr Chen
items.description: A bound notebook filled with technical diagrams and observations
items.text: Research Notes: Nanobot prototype complete! Specifications: 1nm core processor, 50nm propulsion system, 25nm sensor array. Storage location: Secure vault in Research Lab Alpha. Security questions based on project details.

items.name: laboratory computer terminal
items.description: A workstation with multiple monitors displaying research data
items.text: PROJECT DATABASE: Lead Researcher - Dr Sarah Chen. Project Name: Nanobot Assembly Initiative. Funding Source: Advanced Materials Institute. Status: Prototype complete and secured in vault.

items.name: chemical storage cabinet
items.description: A locked cabinet containing various chemicals and materials

items.name: vault access memo
items.description: An official memo about vault security procedures
items.text: CONFIDENTIAL MEMO: Vault access requires answering security questions. Q1: Who leads this research project? Q2: Where is the nanobot prototype stored? Q3: What organization funds this research?

items.name: electron microscope station
items.description: A sophisticated microscope setup for viewing nanoscale structures

items.name: microscope calibration card
items.description: A reference card with measurement standards
items.text: Calibration Standards: 1 nanometer = 0.001 micrometers. Cabinet combination uses nanobot dimensions in nanometers: core (1), propulsion (50), sensors (25). Enter as continuous number.

items.name: nanotech vault door
items.description: A reinforced titanium vault door with biometric scanner and security terminal. Three security questions are displayed on the screen.

password_questions.question: Who leads this research project?
password_questions.hint: Check the safety manual and computer terminal for the lead researcher

password_questions.question: Where is the nanobot prototype stored?
password_questions.hint: The research notes mention the storage location

password_questions.question: What organization funds this research?
password_questions.hint: Look at the computer terminal database for funding information

rooms.name: Nanotech Secure Vault
rooms.description: You have reached the secure vault! A climate-controlled chamber with reinforced walls. In the center, on a magnetic levitation platform, floats a sealed containment unit holding the nanobot prototype. The microscopic machines shimmer with an iridescent glow. Monitors display real-time data on the nanobots. An emergency exit leads to the outside.

items.name: nanobot containment unit
items.description: A transparent sealed container holding billions of microscopic nanobots that glow with inner light

items.name: magnetic levitation platform
items.description: An advanced platform using magnetic fields to suspend the containment unit in mid-air

items.name: nanobot monitoring system
items.description: A bank of screens showing magnified views and data streams from the nanobots
items.text: MONITORING DATA: Nanobot Prototype Status - STABLE. Count: 10 billion units. Functionality: 100%. Applications: Medical repair, environmental cleanup, precision manufacturing. Project success confirmed.

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You have accessed the nanotech vault and secured the revolutionary nanobot prototype. The microscopic machines represent a breakthrough in nanotechnology that will change the world. Mission accomplished! You win!
